Twatboy, don't try to open the rar file, use the Mastercollection.exe file to open it instead.

Is this the trial download on Adobe's site?

Cause it lacks Acrobat, and that should be included in purchased DVD.

Also, the included keygen does not have and CS5 options.

If you're wondering why this (the trial) is so small compared to the beta:

From adobes site:

Thank you for your interest in evaluating Adobe® Creative Suite® 5 Master Collection software. The trial version offers almost every feature of the product for you to test-drive.*

    * 64-bit OS required for Adobe After Effects® CS5 and Adobe Premiere® Pro CS5
    * The Adobe Acrobat® 9 Pro trial (Windows® only) is available separately* from the downloads page

From the trial FAQ:

*Adobe Acrobat® 9 Pro is not available as a trial for Mac OS. Adobe Encore® CS5 software is not available as a trial. Encore CS5 will be installed as part of the trial for Creative Suite 5 Production Premium and Master Collection but will not be available for use until you purchase. The trial versions of Adobe After Effects® CS5, Adobe Premiere® Pro CS5, and Soundbooth® CS5 software do not include some features that depend on software licensed from parties other than Adobe. For example, some codecs for encoding MPEG formats are available only with the full version of these products.

------------


You are better off using the beta until the retail version comes out, otherwise you may encounter some technical difficulties.
